item.title: From Biased Chatbots to Biased Agents: Examining Role Assignment Effects on LLM Agent Robustness
item.description: arXiv:2602.12285v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Large Language Models (LLMs) are increasingly deployed as autonomous agents capable of actions with real-world impacts beyond text generation. item.title: CLASE: A Hybrid Method for Chinese Legalese Stylistic Evaluation
item.description: arXiv:2602.12639v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Legal text generated by large language models (LLMs) can usually achieve reasonable factual accuracy, but it frequently fails to adhere to the specialised stylistic norms and linguistic conventions of legal writing. item.description: arXiv:2602.12375v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Optimistic value estimates provide one mechanism for directed exploration in reinforcement learning (RL).
